title: Recurring payments doesn't navigate anywhere on iOS
description:
After getting the membership of an account, the recurring payments option will be visible in the ChannelMoreMenu. But in the navigation stack the RecurringPayments page is not added to the stack on iOS.

![image](/uploads/7982b4fb3e0cfda47059550b11e06056/image.png)

title: Check the possibility of use code push again.
description:
### Summary
Now that we eliminated the pain points that we were having using code push we can take advantage of it. It can help to deliver faster updates/fixes to the users.

There was a known issue with iOS and the Hermes JS engine that seem to be fixed now.

In case it can be used on both platforms we will create a new task to define how to integrate it into our workflow

### Tasks

- [x] Add codepush for both platforms
- [x] Fix any build error
- [x] Test updating the app for both platforms

title: Large Text in Newsfeed Posts
description:
This is my last attempt at resisting this feature. 
## Can somebody explain the logic behind why short texts have to be large in the newsfeed? Do the pros outweigh the cons? 
I understand that this is inspired from F.

The Cons I see:
1. ## Being less readable
2. Reducing simplicity
3. Reducing newsfeed homogeneity

I understand that there has been limitation in the implementation of this feature but maybe it's worth to explore its possibilities once more

title: Profile Page tweaks
description: - [x] Remove view count from main channel landing page - [ ] If I'm on my channel, I see that I'm subscribed to myself - [x] Move all avatar/banner editing into channel editor - [x] Display description of each badge upon tap (Minds+, Verified, Pro, Admin, Investor) - [x] Change pin icon to reflect twitter design - [x] Filter bar should move above and change to dialbar icon - [x] Change material icons to be outlines - [x] Add slight animation to vote and remind - [x] Other minor channel design tweaks - [x] Move search into ellipsis - [x] Experiment with left aligned profile, title, and username - [x] Experiment with moving the message icon to a FAB in bottom right - [ ] When user scrolls down, navbar and message FAB should hide (with animation obv.) and when the user scrolls up they should appear - [x] Redesign navbar - [x] move subscribers, subscriptions to the end of channel header and swap the count and labels so that count comes first - [x] Improve Call2Action of subscribe button - [x] Remove join button and add a Memberships tab and show the tiers there to reduce user cognitive load - Bonus: --- Before/After *filter icon is a little misaligned Alternative version Engagement buttons before/after Search and banner animation on iOS (search input may need some small modifications) Navbar when scrolled down *icon sizes should be enlarged Badge tooltips

title: WIP: Better Touchables
description:
General improvements in intractability and expectability of the app

## Touchability

- small, borderless elements should have larger hitslops than their size
    - all icons on topbar
        - e.g. topbar back icon
        - e.g. channel top bar ellipsis icon
    - profile icon on main topbar
    - TBD
- elements with a clear border should have a native touchable feedback
    - listItems
        - settings
        - bottom sheets
    - drawer list items
    - settings list items
    - report list items
    - ChannelListItem and group list items
    - TBD
- optional: elements with touchable opacity should have a reduced active opacity
- newsfeed images could have a subtle native touchable feedback (like tw)

## Gestures

- screens should be dismissable from a swipe-in from left on iOS and Android
- portrait viewer should be dismissable with a swipe down from anywhere on the portrait mode

## Navigation and Transitions

- page transitions should have a card stack style like on iOS native, like twitter, and like Telegram
- pressing newsfeed should smooth scroll to top

## UI

- screen header consistency: currently some pages use native headers, and some js headers
    - decide between native or js navbars and apply to all pages

title: Stories UX upgrade
description: **Note**: I'm not sure what the thinking behind the Stories are and what their purpose is but I'm able to see all the stories a user has ever published, which could be potentially a lot, and don't know what to make of that. That's why I can't comment any further than this. Do we have a way to track the performance of specific features and measure their success? or IOW, how do we know whether a big feature, such as Stories, is being successful, to know whether to continue developing it or deprecate it? --- ### Minor UX change - [ ] Tapping on the left side of the screen when a video is playing may restart the video - [ ] Tap and hold may pause videos - [ ] page indicator may be wider for the active page and fill up according to the video progress. Previous pages should be grayed. - [ ] when stories are active the device shouldn't go to sleep (or when videos are playing) - [ ] share dialog opens too quick. it should open with the same speed as other dialogs - [ ] stories loading placeholder doesn't start only after the newsfeed items have loaded. The loading should start at the same time as the newsfeed loading - [ ] swiping guide is shown everytime after opening the app. It should be shown only once. - [ ] swiping gesture on stories has to have a shorter activation gesture distance - [ ] Deleting a story doesn't have a feedback and doesn't remove the story from the list until the list is manually refreshed - [ ] Posting a new story/post will jump the feed scroll position to the second index (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3361) ### Major UX change - [ ] Swiping up from a story may show the comments beneath the story and more details like date and views. Instead of having these indicators on the story itself - [ ] Stories UI openning has to have an animation so users aren't confused about the navigation change - [ ] Stories UI navbar could be simplified (not a fullwidth view) - [ ] Stories UI should be dismissable with a downswipe - [ ] Photo/Story preview after taking a photo is not good ### Speculative - [ ] Double tapping a story could upvote it. Double tap has become a common gesture for approval

title: Fix code warnings and enable LogBox
description:
Fix code warning:
 - key for Portrait bar
 - componentWillMount
 - key for OwnerComponent
 - find/fix other warnings 

Enable LogBox

title: Implement the MMKV storage
description:
Implement MMKV in replacement for AsyncStorage:

We are going to use 4 storages:
1. Session: cleared when the user logs out
2. User: persistent for each user. 
2. UserCache: persistent for each user. Add an option to clear it from settings
3. App: For permanent settings and information across the app (language, data saver, theme, etc)

- [x] Implement new storage
- [x] Improve app initialization taking advantage of the MMKV sync methods
- [x] Implement a migration from AsyncStorage to MMKV to avoid losing sessions and settings with the update
- [x] Replace session storage
- [x] Replace settings storage
- [x] Replace cache storage for requests
- [x] Replace portrait storage and implement TTL
- [x] Refactor update service to use MMKV
- [x] Refactor search bar to use new storage
- [x] Refactor and replace offline data cache using MMKV
  - [x] Entities
  - [x] Channels
  - [x] Feeds
  - [x] Comments
- [x] Remove SQL package and logic
- [x] Fix spec tests
- [x] Fix typescript errors

title: UX Review
description: ## This is WIP These early issues are just a warm-up and include very small issues, proposed features, and many bugs. These are still very random but I'll reorganize them at a later time. The next step is to have a UX discussion and discuss higher level problems and ideas. * note: I wanted to create issues for these but thought that would crowd the issues list. So I'll list them here first. * note: Some of these things (which are the tip of the iceberg) may be considered nit-picky but an elegant UI is all about the details and to make something truly simple one has to do complex things * note: In many of these cases the issue may become irrelevant because the parent of those issues may need to be changed. --- - [x] Splash Screen: first impression matters. The splash screen can be enhanced in a way that the light bulb of the minds logo lights up the whole screen and disappears showing the app content. This also gives more identity to the app. This is just one idea for the splash on top of my head (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3402) - [x] Stories: Tapping on the left side of the screen when a video is playing should restart the video (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Tap and hold should pause videos (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: page indicator should be wider for the active page and fill up according to the video progress. Previous pages should be greyed. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: when stories are active the device shouldn't go to sleep (or when videos are playing) (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Swiping up from a story should show the comments beneath the story and more details like date and views. Instead of having these indicators on the story itself (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: double tapping a story could upvote it. Double tap has become a common gesture for approval (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: share dialog opens too quick. it should open with the same speed as other dialogs (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: stories loading placeholder doesn't start only after the newsfeed items have loaded. The loading should start at the same time as the newsfeed loading (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Stories UI openning has to have an animation so users aren't confused about the navigation change (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Stories UI navbar could be simplified (not a fullwidth view) (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Stories UI should be dismissable with a downswipe (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Photo/Story preview after taking a photo is not good (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: swiping guide is shown everytime after opening the app. It should be shown only once. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: swiping gesture on stories has to have a shorter activation gesture distance (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Dialogs: when dialogs open and dim the background, they should also dim the status bar (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3404) - [ ] Profile Page: chat button takes a ridiculous amount of time to load - [x] Profile Page: chat button opens Minds Chat but doesn't open/create with prompt the direct message with that user (https://gitlab.com/minds/chat-android/-/issues/14) - [x] Profile Page: the tip button/icon has a small touchable area. In general icons have to have a larger touchable area than their icon size. This issue is seen throughout the app. including the message icon in profile page, and show more in text contents. (takes some tries to tap correctly) (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3405) - [x] Profile Page: ellipsis action dialog cancel button's bottom margin is too small - [x] Profile Page: Subscribers, subscriptions and views is not in the same line and looks lazy (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3406) - [ ] I think something has to be done about the icons near the profile. Currently they take too much space, reduce the simplicity of the app, are ambiguous for new users (I still don't understand the airplane icon, and actively thought for some time what the plus icon represented which now I know is minds plus. I'm sure this is common knowledge between old minds users though). I'm not saying they have to be removed but I'm also not crossing that possibility off. - [x] Profile Page: Join button is confusing to me. I've so far seen subscribe, follow, and now I see join. I also can't make sense of "join"ing for example Bill Ottman (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3406) - [x] The Select Dialog is .... (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3407) - [x] Join Dialog: When selecting USD, the SELECT CARD select box doesn't have horizontal margins - [x] Join Dialog: Join membership button has to be full-width and centered. It could also be more attractive. - [x] The dollar icon for tipping may need a redesign. I'm thinking tipping is about supporting rather than being about money (which a dollar sign is about). Also showing the tip button with the dollar sign on every post means the user will see the dollar sign a lot. And that unconsciously makes the user think this is all about money (or in other words emphasizes monetary thinking). which is not a helpful mindset for a social media IMO. Also if all posts have a page for themselves, isn't it possible to move the tip button inside the post rather than making it visible on every post? How frequent is tipping? (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3447) - [x] Images: Pan to zoom is essential for any social media with pictures IMO. The view image button in the ellipsis is a hack. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3408) - [x] Images: view image navbar background color is broken. I'm on dark mode on my phone. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3409) - [x] Navbar should hide when the user scrolls down and should appear when the user scrolls up (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3410) - [x] Aren't material icons boring? anyone? I'm thinking about the possibility of doing a custom redesign of important icons (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3447) - [ ] Is there a meaning behind the design of the compose button? I'm just curious - [ ] OPINION: minds plus and minds pro are confusing in regard to branding. They even have the same background image. - [ ] Newsfeed Activity: Ellipsis button and its actiondialog load very slowly - [ ] Newsfeed Activity: name doesn't have touchable feedback - [ ] Bonus: ![image](/uploads/f498b240c07ff09556162633c763c21d/image.png) - [x] The importance of the buttons of like dislike comment etc. are too much for being seen numerous times in the feed. they are too bold. they have to be thinner, accessible, but not in the eye too much. - [x] I tap on a newsfeed post and it opens the stories UI. This is very confusing navigation-wise. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3412) - [x] In the Stories UI, I can see a touchable opacity feedback on texts, but there is no onPress action. And the whole text's opacity is reduced on tap which doesn't look very good. - [ ] Story animation was laggy on my device. Not too much, but noticable. - [x] OPINION: enlarged text when the text content is short is heterogenous with other newsfeed text material and is harder on the eye to read because of larger text (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3413) - [x] Videos: there's a black flash before a video is played which is clunky. especially in Stories (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3449) - [x] Videos: the device shouldn't go to sleep when videos are playing (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3449) - [x] Videos: the playing video should stay floating around when navigating minds. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3449) - [x] Videos: video may keep playing in the background when device is locked. this will make listening to long-form content (podcast, interview, event) far easier. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3449) - [x] Minds Chat: splash screen has UI issues in dark mode (https://gitlab.com/minds/chat-android/-/issues/15) - [x] Camera/compose has to open with animation. It currently has a poor animation and slightly flashes the entire screen white before opening the camera/compose (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3454) - [x] Capture button in camera is grey. It should be an active color like blue. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3454) - [ ] Slide up animation after the app is opened is unnecessary - [ ] I'm confused about the actions of follow and subscribe - [ ] I can't select a portion of the text in posts. I can only copy the entire post. The touchable feedback is also unnecessary - [x] Open a story/post -> tap on up-votes -> subscribe to someone -> the dialog is closed and weird things happen that I don't understand (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3455) - [x] Open a story/post -> tap on up-votes -> unsubscribe from someone -> the dialog is black while the app theme is light (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3424) - [x] Open a story/post -> tap on up-votes -> tap on a profile and go their profile page -> press home button and leave minds -> open minds again -> the upvotes dialog is opened on the profile page (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3456) - [x] Scroll down on main feed -> while scrolling down press on home in tabbar -> the scroll position jumps but the scroll keeps going. What should happen? it should scroll to top with smooth animation and only then start reloading (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3457) - [x] Phone number verification "Send Verification Code" button doesn't have any validation. u can press it while having the phone number field empty and it says verification code sent to +1. The button is also always grey which doesn't make sense. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3458) - [ ] Phone number verification: resend code button doesn't tell me to e.g. wait 2 minutes to get another code. but it has a rate limit so I guess that's fine - [ ] JUST WONDERING: Shouldn't the start earning tokens button have a better call to action? shouldn't it be dismissable? - [x] Analytics: the tabs aren't scrollable

title: Investigate the posibility of use MMKV to store offline mode cache
description:
### Summary

Storing offline mode cache in MMKV will increase the write/read performance considerably

The problematic part is to implement some sort of TTL for the cache and old data cleaning

title: Missing image in notifications for image/video entities
description:

title: Error: database or disk is full (code 13)
description:

Maybe give a clear cache option

Sentry Issue: [MOBILE-471](https://sentry.io/organizations/minds-inc/issues/2147210727/?referrer=gitlab_integration)

```
Error: database or disk is full (code 13)
#################################################################
Error Code : 13 (SQLITE_FULL)
Caused By : No available space in disk.
	(database or disk is full (code 13))
#########################################...
  at map (native)
  at apply (native)
...
(5 additional frame(s) were not displayed)
```

title: (bug): New Posts in Stories | Scheduled post show in carousel
description:
Friends talked about seeing scheduled posts that are dated in future in the "new posts carousel" in the app. I checked it out on my phone and I first two posts that I looked at were scheduled (didn't look further).

Example:

![untitled](/uploads/286a95627307347c87171fc9f5693d6e/untitled.mp4)

<details><summary>Old example</summary>
![image](/uploads/d07a06fd3f711c633cbcccc8bc6a21ed/image.png)
</details>

iteration.title: Sprint::3 (Nov 3 - Nov 16, 2021)
iteration.description:
Sprint Objectives:

- Deliver first iteration of build your algorithm on web and mobile
- A\B test guest mode
- Have a ceramic prototype running
- Integrate GAT to CI flow

title: Run debug build on the CI for common branches
description:
For common branches use debug build to run the e2e to speed up de build due to caching
Run release build on stable/x.x.x branches only

title: Add cache to the e2e ios build to speed up CI
Remove sentry maps upload on android CI
description: Only upload the symbols on the final production build of the app

title: Reimplement e2e for user onboarding
description:
Reimplement e2e for user onboarding

- Use device.reloadReactNative instead of app launch in the beforeEach callback (faster)
- It could be implemented after the registration in the same

title: Reimplement e2e for register
description:
Reimplement e2e for user registration

- Use device.reloadReactNative instead of app launch in the beforeEach callback (faster)
- Register a new user
- Go to settings and delete it
- Check the possibility of using a dummy database

title: Reimplement e2e for new posts for the composer screen
description:
### Summary
Refactor /e2e/posts.spect.js to /e2e/posts.e2e.js

- Use device.reloadReactNative instead of app launch in the beforeEach callback (faster)
- Use the login action 
- Create tests for: Text only post, NSFW with text, attached image post, check more variants needed (we should test all the composer features)

title: Unable to scroll comments
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Member reports being unable to scroll their comments 
https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1258815431945248768

### Steps to reproduce

The user can replicate from any comments on-site

### Platform information 

Latest app. Android 6.0.1, huawei honor 5x

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Member cannot scroll comments at all

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Member should be able to scroll comments.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1258815431945248768

### Possible fixes

Our mobile team have changed nothing that should cause an effect like this - immediate suspicion was that it could be something to do with the older Android 6.0.0 OS but that doesn't seem to be affecting a Browserstack Galaxy S7 (Android 6) that I tested with.

![image](/uploads/b71564725018618918cd38d7fda31b12/image.png)

title: Align iOS keyboard theme with the system
description:
When accessing a keyboard from any app on my phone, the keyboard theme reflects the system theme. In my case, 'Dark Mode'.

Is it possible to update the Minds App so the system theme and internal keyboards within the app match? All keyboard instances in Minds seem to be always displayed in Light mode.

![IMG_3360](/uploads/582a1567510f595ecc59ea6c7fc7ae96/IMG_3360.PNG)

cc @msantang78

title: Implement improved actionsheet designs
description:
The current implementation of action sheets varies somewhat from screen to screen. Some screens use a native implementation, whereas others use custom styling.

In an attempt to streamline UI assets and make the overall UX more predictable, we should consolidate all action sheets, to use a single and improved design. In addition, action sheet functionality could be extended to cover select/dropdown controls.

The following areas in the mobile application should be addressed.


### Comments

- [x] Comments (tapping on a comment ellipsis, on a post authored by the current user) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/l1Qrbw7
- [x] Comments (tapping comment ellipsis as a comment owner) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/v81x8KM
- [x] Create comment (tapping on the ellipsis relative to the add comment component) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/4aE9axd

### Newsfeed

- [x] Post (viewer) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/l1rqOnd
- [x] Post (owner) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/agbk4mz
- [x] Filter feed (channel) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/VrvZ3Do
- [x] Remind/quote post - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/paA9vWQ

### Wallet

- [x] Filter transactions - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/kaLrg8l (TBD how date range selection would function here - could be omitted if proving too complicated)
- [x] Wallet balance ellipsis - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/oYL1ag0


### Channels
- [x] General channel ellipsis - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/agbqD9z

### Other
* Light mode example - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/xr2yJJV

### Structure
You can see attached the building blocks of a action sheet here. https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/52AYxGx

### Animation
See example animation using the following framer URL -> https://framer.com/share/Mobile-Navigation-Minds-iOS--ogwGjNnMFrUaSpljQJ2A/q0H8kNRcv?editor=1

### Notes
We would in the future like to be able to use the action sheet concept to communicate important user messages. For example, notices such as 'Upgrade to Minds+', 'Setup your wallet' or 'Download chat'. See -> https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/1KLGyQp - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/1KLGyQp - We're not in a position to implement this now, but is possibly worth considering at this point.

Once we're happy with the above proposition, I'll remove the WIP tag from this issue.

cc: @ottman @jotto141 @rcaferati @msantang78 @juanmsolaro

title: build error xcode 12.5
description:
### Summary

Build error on the latest release of code, needed to use latest iOS on the devices.

title: Error downloading file when downloading an image
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Reported by [\@RisingSouth](https://www.minds.com/RisingSouth/)
Via https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1249751885654081536

Errors are thrown when downloading image files

### Steps to reproduce

Try to download an image 

### Platform information 

Reported on v4.13 - Samsung s20 Ultra Android 11. - the member notes downgrading to 4.7.1  works.

replicated on v4.13 version using an S10

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Can't download image.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Should be able to download image.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/87fe95b13d90d7cdba8c4ccbb43d492d/image.png)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)
